name: Masala Papad
history: Masala Papad is a popular Indian appetizer or snack, featuring crispy papadums topped with a spicy and tangy mixture of onions, tomatoes, and spices. It's a staple in many Indian restaurants and households for its simplicity and flavor.
description: Masala Papad is a quick and flavorful dish made with roasted or fried papadums, which are thin, crisp disc-shaped foods, topped with a fresh mix of chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and spices. It's often served as a starter or side dish.

equipment.name: pan or microwave
equipment.description: For roasting or frying the papad.

instructions.title: Prepare Topping
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix together chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, coriander leaves, chaat masala, red chili powder, lemon juice, and salt.

instructions.title: Roast or Fry Papads
instructions.description: Roast the papads over an open flame or fry them until crispy. You can also microwave them for a healthier option.

instructions.title: Assemble Masala Papad
instructions.description: Spread the prepared topping evenly over the roasted or fried papads. If desired, garnish with sev.

instructions.title: Serve Immediately
instructions.description: Serve the Masala Papad immediately as an appetizer or snack.

tips: Serve the Masala Papad immediately after assembling to maintain the crispness of the papad.
Adjust the amount of green chilies and spices according to your taste.
variations: Add grated carrots or beetroots for additional color and nutrition.
Sprinkle with roasted cumin powder for an extra flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Papads may lose crispness if stored.
storage.instructions: Assemble just before serving to retain crispness.

presentationTips: Serve on a colorful plate to enhance the visual appeal.
Garnish with a lemon wedge or sprinkle with finely chopped fresh herbs.
